1.content:
Dear Doctor,

Welcome to online training course on management of Tuberculosis offered by National TB control program, Pakistan.

2.content: National TB Control Program has developed this course to facilitate the health care providers, especially doctors, to learn the management of TB as per National guidelines and online reporting.

3.title: Dear Doctor,
3.content:
The course methodology is reading narrative portion,
scenario based interactive learning and exercise.

You are advised to carefully read the narrative portion
for understanding the guidelines on respective topics.

Then START interactive learning portion, in which you
have to choose correct option(s). In case of choosing
incorrect option, the online facilitator will help you by highlighting the correct option along with some explanation. The case scenario is
followed by an exercise.

At the end of each module, there will also be a post evaluation.

4.content: After the successful completion of each module, you will be able to understand and apply your knowledge in TB patient management as per NTP guidelines.

5.title:
This course comprises

of 8 Modules
5.content: The course is designed to be interactive to promote active learning instead of reading information. There is narrative portion at the start of each session to understand the guide - lines, followed by case scenarios and the post test at the end of each session.

6.title: Following are the Modules
6.content:
• 1. Introduction to Basics of TB & Its Control in Pakistan.
  • 2. Identifying & Managing a “Presumptive TB Case” & “Diagnosing TB”
  • 3. Classifying, Registering & Prescribing Anti–TB Medicine & Treatment Adherence.
  • 4. Patient Follow-Up at TB Care Facility & Managing Side Effects.
  • 5. Treatment Outcomes & Managing Patient Who Interrupt Treatment.
  • 6. Mandatory TB Notification Act & How You Can Notify Online.
  • 7. What is Latent TB infection & Its Management?
  • 8. Drug Resistant TB & Role of General Practitioners in Management of MDR-TB

7.content: Before starting the course, there will be a “pre-evaluation” which is a self-assessment of knowledge about TB & its management

8.content: After completing each Module you are advised to take a “post-evaluation” to assess the improvement in existing knowledge on TB management according to National guidelines.
